clinical_study.brief_title: NT-proBNP as a Tool for the Detection of Acute Pulmonary Artery Embolism (APE)
clinical_study.official_title: NT-proBNP: a Useful Tool for the Detection of Acute Pulmonary Artery Embolism in Post-surgical Patients

brief_summary.textblock: In patients with suspected APE (Acute Pulmonary Embolism) referred to the intensive care unit (ICU)after major surgery, serum NT-proBNP (N-terminal proBNP), Troponin-I and D-dimers were measured according to the standard hospital protocol. To definitively confirm or exclude APE, all patients underwent an angiographic CT-scan of the thorax.

detailed_description.textblock:
In patients with suspected APE referred to the intensive care unit after major surgery, serum NT-proBNP, Troponin-I and D-dimers were measured according to the standard hospital protocol. Blood samples were obtained within one hour after the onset of clinical symptoms.
Definitive confirmation or exclusion of APE was performed with an angiographic CT-scan of the thorax.

primary_outcome.measure: Acute pulmonary embolism: CT-proof yes vs. no
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 hour after onset of clinical symptoms

clinical_study.condition: Pulmonary Embolism Without Mention of Acute Cor Pulmonale

arm_group.description: Post-surgical patients with clinically suspected acute pulmonary embolism

study_pop.textblock: Patients after major surgery referred to the anesthesiologic ICU due to suspected acute pulmonary embolism.
